Package com.mixpanel.android.mpmetrics

This package contains the interface to Mixpanel that you can use from your Android apps.

See: Description

  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    MixpanelAPI.People
    Core interface for using Mixpanel People Analytics features.
    OnMixpanelUpdatesReceivedListener
    For use with MixpanelAPI.People.addOnMixpanelUpdatesReceivedListener(OnMixpanelUpdatesReceivedListener)
    SuperPropertyUpdate
    Use SuperPropertyUpdate objects to make changes to super properties in place, in a thread-safe way.
    Tweaks.TweakChangeCallback
    You can use this interface together with Tweaks.bind(String, Object, TweakChangeCallback) to get callbacks when a new tweak value is received from Mixpanel.
  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    GCMReceiver
    BroadcastReceiver for handling Google Cloud Messaging intents.
    InAppNotification
    Represents a in-app notification delivered from Mixpanel.
    InstallReferrerReceiver
    BroadcastReceiver for automatically storing Google Play Store referrer information as Mixpanel Super Properties.
    MixpanelAPI
    Core class for interacting with Mixpanel Analytics.
    MPConfig
    Stores global configuration options for the Mixpanel library.
    Survey
    Represents a Survey, configured in Mixpanel.
    Tweaks
    Tweaks are a mechanism for declaring and receiving dynamic values that you can change and deploy to users through Mixpanel.
    Tweaks.TweakDescription
    Represents a tweak (but not a tweak value) known to the system.
  • Enum Summary 
    Enum Description
    InAppNotification.Type
    InApp Notifications in Mixpanel are either TAKEOVERs, that display full screen, or MINI notifications that appear and disappear on the margins of the screen.
    Survey.QuestionType
    Surveys are of type MULTIPLE_CHOICE, containing a selection of possible answers, or TEXT, which allow free text responses from users.
  • Annotation Types Summary 
    Annotation Type Description
    Tweaks.TweakType  

Package com.mixpanel.android.mpmetrics Description

This package contains the interface to Mixpanel that you can use from your Android apps. You can use Mixpanel to send events, update people analytics properties, display push notifications and other Mixpanel-driven content to your users. The primary interface to Mixpanel services is in MixpanelAPI. At it's simplest, you can send events with 
 

 MixpanelAPI mixpanel = MixpanelAPI.getInstance(context, MIXPANEL_TOKEN);
 mixpanel.track("Library integrated", null);
In addition to this reference documentation, you can also see our overview and getting started documentation at https://mixpanel.com/help/reference/android
